body:
The problem is how to estimate N. Too small an
estimate, and you will end up reallocate the slice
a few times and incur much bigger overhead, and
too big an estimate you will just waste memory.

The minimum and maximum is different enough that
I don't think we can estimate N accurately without
traversing the string once.

Anyway, if you think you can do better, perhaps
you should write an implementation that only
traverse the string once and do some benchmark
to show it's superior than the current implementation.
It's better than arguing here without any concrete
benchmark numbers.
